body.p:
I am in receipt of your esteemed form
of March 14th and also of a box containing 5 sets festival prayers
pr Sarah which arrived here on the 2nd Inst. The Books however were
not landed till yesterday, as from the tenor of your letter, it was
impossible to imagine there was anything on board for me, as not her
letter of advice nor B/L waqs sent with them. In fact, a few days
after the arrival of the vessel she sailed for a neighbouring port and
while sailing out of the Harbour I learned there was a parcel
on board to my address. I was therefore compelled to await her return
The Books were in good order and have been delivered to the party who
ordered them. I have sold them at fourteen dollars pr set, contenting
myself with 3⅓ % rather than lose the sale. Consequently there is in
my hands sixty seven dollars fifty cents, say $67,50, to your credit
which shall be very soon remitted. I regret to say, that your Bibles
do not sell quickly, there are but few here who know or care any thing
about Biblical literature, and still fewer who care about an English
Translation. You are indebted to Elias Lindo's unwearied energy
for the few already sold. I have neither the time nor the strength
to walk about with a Bible under my arm offering it for a sale. During
E L's visit to your city, he must have given you ample information respec
ting this Island. But even if he has not done so, it is too disagreeable
a subject to enlarge upon. In future unless specifically ordered
I would not recommend you to send any Books here, If I can
sell those on hand minus my commission I will do so, and without
my boasting I would do any thing else in my humble way to serve you,
but to sell books is almost an impossibility here.

Dutch & French books are obtained and used by many and I am
I confess, surprised, not at the small number you sold, but at the great number
On a future occasion, if you should send any more here, be a little more
particular, about sending notice of shipment, for if in this instance
the Box and its contents, had been lost, the fault would not have
been mine. How is it no Occidents have arrived by the Venus?
or the Sarah? If you have them ready you can send them
to Messrs D Appleton & Co. N.Y. who have to send me some
books, and they will pack up with them up in the same trunk.
Excuse the apparent negligence of my letter, I am compelled
to write at night, after elven hours of tiresome teaching, and
my sight begins to fail slightly. Do not wonder at my not ordering
any of your Catechisms & other works, my school is not a religious
one, but licensed by the Island authorities and except during
one hour in the morning, nothing that can strictly be called
religion is permitted, the pupils consisting of Israelites Protestants
and Catholics, as in all the other schools here, and they are far
too numerous, to yield any thing like a proper remuneration
for so arduous an employment as teaching. A change
may take place as the Mahamad has at last written to Holland
for a Hebrew. I had urged this from my arrival, as it is really
lamentable, to see the oldest congregation the W I. nay the western
world, and which formerly had its Hebrew and Hebrew now without
either. I am sure there are not six persons in the Congregation
who understand any thing of Hebrew except the mere reading
nor have my they any taste for it. I have done all I could to diffuse
a taste, and my want of success I must attribute to my unfitness
for I do not feel authorised to blame others the community till
others better qualified than I have attempted the task, I await
the result and hope it may be successful, tho' the fault rest with me

Excuse this long intelligible scrawl. Hoping you
are quite well and with kind regards in which ?
unites.

PS Do not send me more number of the Occident than those
named—which I believe are 4. Edwards, Julien D Caperes
P Jesurun. E Lindo must have paid you the subscription, con
sequently you may know better than I the exact number.
